column4: trying to mount a linux cifs share that mounts fine on other client machines, and it returns the error "mount: Resource temporarily unavailable".  What's that supposed to mean? ;(
I guess its temporarily unavailable :P
you guys are just at the apex of observation today aren't you? ;)
Indeed :P
anyone know what that actually means?
can you ping the server hosting the share successfully?
there are other shares from the server mounted fine on the same machine, using cifs
ahh
well then I dunno whats happening
great
:P
ima try googling it
yeah i have.  7 results
http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/linux-networking/65366-cifs-mount-error-11-resource-temporarily-unavailable.html
did you try changing cifs to smbfs for test purposes?
i didn't no.  do you mean on the client?
i see that you do
on the mount command. instead of mount -t cifs use mount -t smbfs
ok i'll try that
cpusfunbox: sorry I dont know where to go from there, I dont actually own a Pocket PC
works, cheers :)  what keywords did you use in google?
mount: Resource temporarily unavailable
lol.  should have removed the "
yeah if you keep the " " it things you're searching for that exact string
